info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:54PM EDT until August 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 453 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of New Bethlehem, or 13 miles east of Kittanning, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Bethlehem, Rural Valley, Dayton, Hawthorn, Timblin, Mahoning Creek Lake, Distant, and Templeton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
